Motte’s Platform

INCREASE ACCESS BY PROVIDING MORE CLASS SECTIONS ABOVE CAP

As Board President, I recently authored and passed a resolution which requires instructional administration to schedule increased sections for student enrollment to serve +5% FTES (full time equivalent students) above our state funded revenue cap.  Doing this allowed for increased access for +500 FTES above our funded cap to enroll.  In 2009 state funding workload reductions cut hundreds of class sections.  MSJC is in the process of restoring those lost sections and this policy will escalate doing so.  As trustee, I do not want to increase administrative salary levels until all sections cut in the past previous years are restored.

MAXIMIZE USE OF EXISTING FACILITIES.

Current scheduling practice (Monday thru Thursday w/half day Friday) does not maximize enrollment in our facilites. As trustee, I would like to lobby to change current scheduling practices to accommodate more students. This could be done by a compressed schedule offering of classes Monday thru Friday and a full offering on Saturdays. Increasing the load on existing building usage which positions the district to better compete for state construction bonds (when available) requiring less local match for the project.

Administration does not usually favor such policies as it requires everyone to work on Fridays and others to work week-ends, a position which has more self-interest than student/taxpayer interest. However, it my position that It is imperative for the future of the college to make these changes.

HIRE MORE FACULTY.

When the district makes “CAP” there is increased revenue for hiring of full time faculty. This is in the best interest of our students. Full-time faculty obligation requirements are based upon district growth factors. Faculty are the heart of the college and hiring more faculty needs to always be a priority.  Expenditures such as legal expense and campus security need to be carefully monitored/controlled by the college CEO in order to allow for increase in full time faculty hires as access increases.

CONTROL ADMINISTRATION Levels & Expense

Until all workload reductions of the past are restored and FTES levels are back to the 2009 levels of instruction, it is my position that no administrative salaries should increase and/or administrative positions be added.  The district could benefit from a board approved ratio (administrators to full time students) as a guide for adding new administrative positions.

STEM/TECHNOLOGY CAMPUS IN WILDOMAR.

Through the past 8 years as Trustee, I have worked hard to lobby for the purchase of property in Wildomar for a future state approved campus purposed for STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics).

To go forward with this project, in addition to an EIR, the district must notify the Chancellors Office with a “Letter of Intent” and complete/submit a comprehensive study for state approval of the site which then makes the campus eligible to compete for state construction dollars and receive +$1 mil dollars per year for operations.   I will work hard to accomplish this.

I am not a bureaucrat. Increased student access by serving enrollments above CAP, maximizing use of existing facilities, controlling administrative/legal/campus security expense will provide students and taxpayers the most value per taxdollar provided.  This will be my voice for you on the Board of Trustees.
